subject: POLSH

notes.descrlong: Class will meet 3 times a week for 50 minutes each.

description: In this course, students work on their ability to speak, write, read, and understand contemporary Polish. Students will also develop their intercultural competency. The instructor uses communicative language teaching with emphasis on structured input. Students use the textbook and workbook "Hurra! Po polsku 1" supplemented by Polish-English chapter dictionaries. This class covers chapters 0-9. If a student is not sure of his or her language level, he or she can contact the Polish instructor, Ewa Bachminska, at eb583@cornell.edu.

subject: POLSH

notes.descrlong: Prerequisites: POLSH 1131 or permission of instructor. Class will meet 3 times a week for 50 minutes each.

description: In this course, students work on their ability to speak, write, read, and understand contemporary Polish. Students will also develop their intercultural competency. The instructor uses communicative language teaching with emphasis on structured input. Students use the textbook and workbook "Hurra! Po polsku 1" supplemented by Polish-English chapter dictionaries. This class covers chapters 10-20. If a student is not sure of his or her language level, he or she can contact the Polish instructor, Ewa Bachminska, at eb583@cornell.edu.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: POLSH 1131 or permission of instructor.

subject: POLSH

notes.descrlong: For more information about First-Year Writing Seminars, see the Knight Institute website at http://www.arts.cornell.edu/knight_institute

description: Eastern Europe has contributed unique films to global cinema. In this class, students will watch, discuss, and write about a variety of films: Oscar winners and lesser-known films, thrillers and comedies—from Poland, Russia, Turkey, Kazakhstan, and more. In addition to learning film terminology, students will have the opportunity to become acquainted with the cultures, history and geography of Eastern Europe. Students will write film reviews, technical analyses of films, and personal essays. All class films are available for streaming through Blackboard.
